data.title: Code Yellow blizzard advisory Friday evening through Saturday morning
data.meta_description: The National Meteorology Administration (ANM) issued on Thursday a Code Yellow blizzard advisory for 12 southern and eastern counties, effective Friday evening ...
data.text:
Friday, January 6, 2017

The National Meteorology Administration (ANM) issued on Thursday a Code Yellow blizzard advisory for 12 southern and eastern counties, effective Friday evening through Saturday morning.

The counties under alert are: Neamt, Iasi, Bacau, Vaslui, Vrancea, Galati, Buzau, Braila, Teleorman, Constanta, Ilfov and Calarasi.

According to ANM, there will be moderate snowfalls between January 6, 20:00 p.m. - January 7, 10:00 a.m. in Dobrogea, Baragan and most of Moldavia, with the wind gusting at 50 - 55 km/h and even 70 km/h, temporarily drifting the snow.

The weathermen warned that the wind will also speed temporarily in south-western Oltenia swirling the snow.

Beginning Friday, January 6 until early next week a major freeze will grip most of the country at night and daytime too, with temperature lows ranging between -25 and -15 degrees Celsius.

Depending on weather developments, ANM will update this advisory.

All ports at the Black Sea have been closed for traffic on Friday, starting 01:30, as well as A2 motorway, the sector between Bucharest and km 144, DN5 Bucharest - Giurgiu, and 27 trains on the route Bucharest - Constanta have been cancelled because of adverse weather, according to the Inspectorate General of the Romanian Police (IGPR).

Moreover, a flight was cancelled on the route Bucharest - Istanbul.

To manage the weather phenomena, in addition to the current teams, a number of 2,662 police officers acted with 1,842 devices, the Press Office of the Inspectorate General of the Romanian Police (IGPR) points out.

In Buzau County, car traffic was closed on the following roads: DN 2B Buzau - Braila, DN 22 Ramnicu Sarat - Braila, DN 2 E85 Buzau - Ramnicu Sarat, DN 2C Buzau - Slobozia.

In Vrancea County, the DN 2N Bogza - Dumbraveni, DN 23A Gologanu - Ciorasti, DN 23B Maicanesti - Ciorasti have been closed for traffic, and in Braila County, DN 2B Buzau - Braila and DN 22 Ramnicu Sarat - Braila.

In Teleorman County, national road DN 51 Izvoarele - Zimnicea is closed on the way to Zimnicea.

Military units are prepared to set up accommodation in case of population evacuation from areas affected by inclement weather, announced National Defence Minister, Gabriel Les, on Thursday, at the headquarters of the Ministry of Interior (MAI).

He specified that 2,658 soldiers were ready for intervention, with 376 vehicles, ambulances, autocranes as well as five helicopters and an airplane.

"Measures were taken to increase the rapid reaction capacities of the subunits and detachments for intervention in emergency situations. Snow clearing vehicles were made ready, especially those with enhanced travel, traction and transport capabilities for areas affected by massive snowfall," explained Gabriel Les.
